title: Upper Limb - Brachial Plexus
description: Comprehensive lecture on the anatomy, branches, and clinical significance of the brachial plexus.

title: Neuroanatomy - Circle of Willis
description: Detailed discussion on the arterial circle at the base of the brain and its clinical importance.

title: Abdomen - Portal Venous System
description: Learn about the portal venous system, its tributaries, and clinical significance in portal hypertension.

title: Cardiovascular System - Cardiac Cycle
description: Detailed explanation of the cardiac cycle, heart sounds, and pressure changes during the cycle.

title: Respiratory System - Pulmonary Function Tests
description: Learn about various pulmonary function tests and their clinical interpretation.

title: Enzymes - Kinetics and Inhibition
description: Detailed discussion on enzyme kinetics, Michaelis-Menten equation, and types of enzyme inhibition.

title: Molecular Biology - DNA Replication
description: Comprehensive lecture on the process of DNA replication, enzymes involved, and its regulation.

title: Cell Injury and Adaptation
description: Lecture on the mechanisms of cell injury, cellular adaptations, and cell death.

title: Inflammation - Acute and Chronic
description: Detailed discussion on the process of inflammation, its types, and resolution.

title: Virology - HIV and AIDS
description: Comprehensive lecture on HIV virus, its replication, pathogenesis, and clinical aspects of AIDS.

title: Antimicrobial Drugs - Beta-lactams
description: Detailed lecture on beta-lactam antibiotics, their mechanism of action, and clinical uses.

title: Diabetes Mellitus - Diagnosis and Management
description: Comprehensive lecture on the diagnosis, classification, and management of diabetes mellitus.

title: Acute Abdomen - Approach and Management
description: Detailed discussion on the approach to a patient with acute abdomen and surgical management.

title: Normal Labor and Delivery
description: Comprehensive lecture on the mechanisms of normal labor, stages of labor, and management.

title: Neonatal Resuscitation
description: Detailed lecture on neonatal resuscitation protocols and management of birth asphyxia.
